title: Simple Beet Salad
summary: Simple Beet Salad might be just the side dish you are searching for. This caveman, gluten free, primal, and vegan recipe serves 8 and costs 90 cents per serving. One portion of this dish contains roughly 3g of protein, 10g of fat, and a total of 143 calories. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. A mixture of walnuts, beets, salt and pepper, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 20 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 57%, this dish is pretty good. Try Simple Avocado Beet Salad, Simple Beet, Arugulan and Feta Salad with Hilaryâ€™s Balsamic Thyme Dressing, and Roasted Beet and Shallot Salad over Wilted Beet Greens and Arugula for similar recipes.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400. Divide beets between 2 large pieces of heavy-duty aluminum foil; drizzle with balsamic vinaigrette, and sprinkle with desired amount of salt and pepper. Seal foil, making 2 loose packets.                                                                                                 Bake at 400 for 45 to 55 minutes until fork-tender.                                                                                                 Let cool 1 hour in packets, reserving accumulated liquid.                                                                                                 Bake walnuts at 400 in a single layer in a shallow pan 8 to 10 minutes or until toasted and fragrant.                                                                                                 Peel beets, and cut into slices or wedges. Arrange beets on a serving platter or in a bowl. Drizzle with reserved liquid, and sprinkle with walnuts. Garnish, if desired.

steps.step: Divide beets between 2 large pieces of heavy-duty aluminum foil; drizzle with balsamic vinaigrette, and sprinkle with desired amount of salt and pepper. Seal foil, making 2 loose packets.
Bake at 400 for 45 to 55 minutes until fork-tender.
Let cool 1 hour in packets, reserving accumulated liquid.
Bake walnuts at 400 in a single layer in a shallow pan 8 to 10 minutes or until toasted and fragrant.
Peel beets, and cut into slices or wedges. Arrange beets on a serving platter or in a bowl.
Drizzle with reserved liquid, and sprinkle with walnuts.
